Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Zorbina S
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at this hotel after a cruise. Since we arrived so early, they held our suitcases behind the desk while we wandered around Old San Juan, and they were waiting for us in our rooms when returned in the afternoon. The location is great and the service was excellent. The room was clean and reasonably comfortable, and there's free wi-fi in the lobby. We had one of the rooms in front with a balcony. The plus side is having the cute balcony, with a view of the Plaza. The drawback is having street noise - though we really didn't notice it anyway. The air conditioner fan was loud enough to cover it up, but constant enough to not bother me for sleeping. There's a taxi stand across the street, but since we had an early flight, the manager arranged to have a taxi waiting for us at 5:45 am (the driver was already waiting in the lobby when we checked out around 5:30). He also arranged for us to have an early wake-up call at 5am (there's no phone in the room - the wake up "call" was a knock at the door), but it was right on time. There was an alarm clock in the room, but it was nice to have the extra assurance of the wake-up call. It's not fancy, but it was a good value for Old San Juan. We also stayed at Hotel Milano pre-cruise, and I felt that the two hotels were pretty comparable, and would stay again at either one.

Reviews.Title: “Constantly improving”
Reviews.Author: miken-11
Reviews.Content: This was our sixth stay in the last six years at this hotel. Each time we have not been disappointed. We use this hotel as a yearly pre cruise starting point for our vacation. We usually stay two nights. This hotel is not fancy, but clean and affordable. There are no windows or free breakfast, but the staff is very friendly and accomodating especially Luis, the manager.This hotel is right in the heart of Old San Juan and is within walking distance of all restaurants,shoppng, sight seeing and the cruise docks. If your looking for all the frills and ocean view rooms like the major hotel chains with the fancy price, this is not the hotel for you. But if you want a clean place to stay with a great location and friendly staff, I highly recomend them. Hopefully we see them again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stella2626`
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location but I was a little skeptical at what we would encounter after reading the reviews. However, I think the people who have issues with this hotel have really high standards and didn't do their research. The elevator is very interesting and if you are claustrophobic, you shouldn't get in it. We didn't experience any problems with it while we were there (February 25). The rooms were clean and because they are inside rooms, we had no problem with noise. The phone didn't work in our room but we didn't need it. My sister and brother-in-law's TV didn't work and they were unable to control the air conditioner. It was either on or off instead of regulated by temperature. However we weren't in the room that much - only to sleep and shower. It is great for a pre-cruise stay and we will stay there again. The staff was nice and helpful when we needed something. We walked to both forts from there, Walgreen's, Wendy's and other food places are right there. We also walked to the cruise pier from the hotel. It is all downhill so it is an easy walk with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Amy A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights prior to cruising out of San Juan. We were prepared that this hotel was not fancy, so we weren't surprised by this. The hotel rooms do not have windows, but we were prepared for this as well. The building is old, but historical. The rooms were clean and the service was great! The staff is wonderful! Luis, the manager, accommodated our needs very well. This hotel is within walking distance of everything that you would need, restaurants, drug store, sightseeing, etc. If you are looking for a fancy place to stay close to the beach, this is not it, but we were pleasantly surprised with our stay. Keep in mind that the buildings in Old San Juan are old. Again, the staff there was just wonderful. We would stay here again for a short time similar to how we did this time.

Reviews.Title: “Reservations not important”
Reviews.Author: Dave J
Reviews.Content: made reservations in Aug. 2011 for room with two twin beds, verbally confirmed it on Jan. 2nd 2012. when we got there on March 3rd I was told I was "not getting a room with twin beds because hotel was full!" I provided a print out of my reservation with confirmation number and I was told I was not getting the room I had reserved!!! Shower didn't drain. I was offered no resolution, I was made to feel like take the room or go some where else!!! This is horrible customer service and I will not stay or recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice find!!”
Reviews.Author: IndyCruiseLover
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel, but with BIG potential! We stayed one night, but highly recommend visiting here! We came in early for a cruise and arrived at the hotel at 12:30 AM. Had no problem checking in at such a late hour. The staff is positively wonderful! To get to our room on the fourth floor, we entered a cute, small elevator. It is VERY SMALL and antiquated, but that just adds to the charm. It works fine if you are patient. Our room was clean and roomy, but not window. The air conditioner adds a lot of white noise to help us sleep peacefully. Such a charming hotel that has been kept as a big secret! I can't complement the staff enough!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed by this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: evriv
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here because of the price and the location. If there is a next time I will stay else where. The location was great; however the hotel is run down. This is really too bad since the structure has potential. The room felt dirty and the king bed did not have king sheets on the bed! They did not have phone service and had to knock on our door for wake up service! I did not sleep all night due to the noise form the street, buses, trucks etc...The front desk was friendly, despite asking for recommendations for local food. We know the difference between local and tourist traps; since we are Puerto Rican. I hope they renovate and clean up their act. By they way this property is no longer owned by Howard Johnson!

Reviews.Title: “Great service in an Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MdPeter
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying at this Hotel because of some earlier reviews.Luis Garzon, Guest Relations Manager at Hotel Plaza De Armas, told me not to worry. The Hotel Plaza De Armas is in a great location. It is convenient to all areas of Old San Juan. The Trolley stops a half block away. Taxi cabs are available out front. It is a short walk to Cafeteria Mallorca for breakfast (mallorca con mantequilla) or to church around the corner. We chose Hotel Plaza De Armas because of price and location. We chose not to have a refrigerator or a balcony. You shouldn't complain if you chose not to get these items and didn't get them for free. The rooms were pretty basic. They were clean and comfortable enough. The bathroom was clean and there was abundant hot water. Everything appeared to work. There were no bugs. The front desk staff was charming and very helpful. They appear to be very honest and hard working people trained in hotel service. They do not perform miracles. They watched our luggage for us and gave us whatever advice we requested. There is a restaurant at the front of the hotel. The elevator is slow and only holds 4 people or 1,200 pounds. We were happy that there was an elevator. Historic hotels don't always have elevators. If you want more amenities, go somewhere else and pay for them. Luis Garzon, Guest Relations Manager at Hotel Plaza De Armas, was right. He made sure that we didn't have to worry. He was the most charming and helpful person in the city. Thankyou Luis.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed at all!!”
Reviews.Author: SaintBeatz
Reviews.Content: Pros: Service was good. The people at the desk were friendly. Cons: Old building. Elevator is 1,000 years old and honestly takes 15 minutes to go up and down. Plumbing was horrible. Hot water worked but very slow. Our room was like a dungeon. There were no windows and we overslept the 1st night we got there. Also no refridgerator. Would not go there again nor would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Kathy H
Reviews.Content: The benefit of this hotel is its location. You can walk to every restaurant, attraction, etc. Yes, it is an old building (no windows) and the elevator is slow but to me, that's what gives this hotel some character. It is not the typical fancy building most people are used to. I would definitely stay there again. The people were friendly and the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: cyclinjohn
Reviews.Content: An old building with tastefully decorated rooms, modern plumbing, free wifi. The catch? Many of the rooms are windowless, so if you require a window, keep looking. Wonderful location on the Plaza in Old San Juan. Convenient to forts, stores and restaurants. Walk to transit. Taxi stand at front door. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “It is out of a horror movie...”
Reviews.Author: miumiu4me
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here before switching to a nicer place. I cannot caution people enough about staying here. This hotel used to be army barracks 50 years ago. There have been no serious renovations since then... Our room was windowless. Because of a storm, the tv, internet, and phone were out. The AC was a wall unit that was controlled by the hotel. It was super loud and it gave the room a musty smell. The second night, the room became freezing and we had to find an employee at 2am (not an easy feat) to give us the remote to lower it. The elevator fits 2 people at a time. If the elevator door is not fully closed, it will not move. The people at the front desk were very nice though. The location of this dump is great too. But I wouldn't stay here for free.

Reviews.Title: “Would not pay money to stay here”
Reviews.Author: bluzchick70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with another couple for 4 days pre-cruise. Location: I thought it was perfect. Walked around the city every day, much quicker to walk anywhere versus taking a taxi. The streets are very narrow and VERY congested. The plaza was very loud into the weeee morning hours but we were there for New Years Eve and the party didn't stop! We did have a balcony on our room which was nice. Sat out there every night. Not much privacy from your neighbors. The doors that lead from your room to the balcony...well let's just say I hope it doesn't rain or become very windy when you are here or you would be in for a surprise. There were huge gaps(which I suppose means bugs can come in also) in the doors. There was at least half an inch of noticeable dust on the top of the curtains as well as the pipes below the bathroom sink. I had a controlled substance (prescription) that was stolen on the second night(so guess who didn't sleep?!) The front desk didn't really care and in fact stated their staff would do no such thing..end of story. The air conditioner worked perfectly. Good water pressure, and hot water always..even on the top floor. Sitting area with TV toward back of hotel but no working vending machines, coffee, books etc... We kept our luggage in the lobby when we checked out as did most everyone else. We were welcome to return to the hotel at any time to use the bathroom or sit and relax before we could board the ship at 4pm or so. This was nice! The luggage was everywhere and they were busy checking in people so it is not "watched" I think this hotel would benefit from having food available. There is room in the back sitting area, there may even be a bar but I can't remember, that could be used. Elevator is scarey! It quit working when we were there, they put a sign on the main floor only that it was out of service. A cable was frayed and was fixed the following day. It would have been nice to have a sign on EVERY floor instead of having guests get in and wait forever(thank goodness the cable didn't snap!) No problem getting a taxi. They took all of our luggage and to the cruise terminal we went, for $28. We stayed here only because my husband had racked up enough points and it was "free" for us. I would NOT spend what they charge to stay here and I am a pretty low maintenance person.

Reviews.Title: “We were ripped off”
Reviews.Author: obnc
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before our cruise based on other traveler's recommendations. We were led astray! The building is very old, and to get to our room we had to either navigate a narrow flight of stairs or use the tiny elevator. Our room was small and hot with only local TV channels. Upon check in, we were asked to swipe our credit card as a "deposit" for the air conditioner control, which we returned at checkout. We were told no charges would appear on our credit card. However, when we returned home from our cruise there was a $124 charge to my credit card even though I prepaid my hotel bill. I was unable to resolve the problem with my bank, so I got burned for the bogus charge. Beware of this place!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so charming”
Reviews.Author: Tropicaldream1971
Reviews.Content: I decided to treat my husband to a trip to PR for father's day weekend and thought this hotel location in the San Juan area was ideal, but soon found out the location was the only good thing going on for this place. The very old looking elevator seemed to be out of order most of the time, the rooms were not that clean and "fresh smelling". The description of the room stated that coffee was provided, there was none available. I ask the housekeeper and she said that the "supplier" did not made the coffee delivery on time. We left the room to buy some and when we came back to our room the housekeepers cart was next to our room and we saw a pack of coffee. What a bunch of incompetent and liars! The place feels like you're walking into an oven and I felt very uncomfortable. The only nice person working there is a lady by the name of YAITZA. She was very friendly and pleasant...if only everyone else was the same...

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: SeraseraX
Reviews.Content: Please do yourself a favor and don't stay at this hotel. It's not clean, dark, and unfriendly. You may think from the location it sounds like a great place and deal, but it's not. 1. There is so much road construction and all the streets are one-way that it's almost impossible to get to the hotel even with a gps. Once you get there you find out you have to park your car down a huge hill, and walk back to the hotel since there is no valet. 2. There is really nothing to do in old San Juan, don't waste your vacay in this dirty old town. 3. There was only one elevator that was like a box... You had to close two doors to make it move in slow motion. 4. Our room had a balcony, but all night long you were hearing honnking and the garbage trucks at 4 am. 5. Our phone and safe was broken. As well, the tv was from the 90s. I wish I had researched a better hotel and didn't waste 2 days in this dump. :)

Reviews.Title: “Very old hotel, good location, staff needs customer service training”
Reviews.Author: SuePennsylvania
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 days following a 7 day cruise. Very good location, unfortunate that the staff and hotel does not measure up to the location! ----Hair in the shower--GROSS ----Only 1 channel available on the TV ----Staff had a hard time explaining how to use the ancient elevator ----Terrible A/C

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Not much else!!”
Reviews.Author: littletonsa
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews about this hotel before booking. I thought people were being overly critical. This was a super location. For $100 plus tax. How could we go wrong. Well, now I know. We stayed here for one night before our cruise. The lobby was full of people checking in and they had one person working the front desk. It took us over one hour to check in and get to our room. We had to go up the elevator in "shifts" because there was not enough room for two people and luggage. After touring OSJ all day we came back to find out that we had absolutely no hot water at all. The front desk clerk said nothing could be done because it was Sunday. We were also told that we could not change rooms because the hotel was full. The air conditioner was on high and blew directly down upon our bed. We could not adjust the temperature or get it to turn off. We were told the same thing, it was Sunday, nothing could be done. We were also told that there were no more blankets. We spent a miserable night. The next morning when we went to check out the clerk at the front desk said she had not been told about the lack of hot water and the air conditioner problem. We were so glad to check out and get to our cruise ship. Never again, I should have paid attention to the reviews I read before booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but not perfect in a fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: Vega_7
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at the Plaza de Armas and enjoyed its quirky imperfections. Housed in a 17th Century building in the very heart of Old San Juan, the location was ideal. The vintage elevator wasnâ€™t working when we were there, but it was fun to wind our way up the narrow stairs â€“ it accentuated the age and history of the place and reminded me of passages Iâ€™d taken to rooms above old pubs in Europe. But it would be tight with large suitcases. While there, we learned that there used to be only one bathroom per floor until about 7 years ago, so the building has been completely retrofitted to include more convenient modern plumbing (each room with itâ€™s own bath) fairly recently. We did not mind small rooms, or dark rooms, as we only slept there. Our adventure was outdoors, wandering the fabulous blue cobblestone streets of Old San Juan and surrounds. Our room and bathroom were clean, we had hot water, didnâ€™t try the phone (we have cell phones) nor did we try the TV â€“ we came in exhausted from our wanderings each day and collapsed and are not big TV watchers. The staff was always friendly and helpful. There was no restaurant or food in the building while we were there â€“ but there doesnâ€™t need to be. There are fabulous restaurants everywhere. For breakfast, we went a few blocks to the Hotel El Convento (a $350 a night place) and had a wonderful breakfast in a beautiful setting for about $10 each. Itâ€™s not the Ritz, itâ€™s not a resort, and itâ€™s not a boutique hotel, but it doesnâ€™t try to be, so if thatâ€™s what you want, this is not the place. If you want to be in an historic property right in the middle of Old San Juan for a pretty good value and can be easy going if need be about minor inconveniences, the Plaza de Armas may suit you just fine.

Reviews.Title: “This place was highly over rated on the web site.”
Reviews.Author: snowht5
Reviews.Content: The room was barely adequate. Absolutely no parking- you have to use a public lot - not a short walk back and certainly not cheap. The street noise gets very loud around five am with all the garbage and delivery trucks making their rounds. No sleeping through that. As the other reviews say, the elevator NEVER works and one local told us he was probably one of the last people to ride it when it was working- many years ago. Good luck finding the hot water setting in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for budget travel”
Reviews.Author: hudsonallen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night before and the night after we cruised out of San Juan. We wanted a clean place, great location close to the cruise terminal, and nothing fancy. We accomplished all three of those goals. First, everyone must be aware that the hotel is located in a 17th century building, so things are not the same as in recent construction. Some rooms have windows and others do not. We stayed in two different rooms (one with a window and one without), and they were both fine. The room was clean, the plumbing worked fine, and the bed was clean. It is an island nation on island time, so we knew that the American concept of "everything five minutes ago" was not applicable here. The elevator worked - it was small and slow, but worked fine. The staff, when not being yelled at by rude tourists, were quite nice. They helped with restaurant suggestions, held our bags until our room was ready, and had taxis waiting for us when we needed them. The location was phenomenal. The plaza right at the door of the hotel is one of the oldest meeting places in the city. Each night we were there, people were hanging out, visiting with each other, children were playing and celebrating the holidays. It was great for people watching. Also, there is a pharmacy (in case you forgot anything for your vacation or need a soda), numerous restaurants within walking distance, and a 24/7 little cafe in the plaza in case of jet lag. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel. Unacceptable.”
Reviews.Author: UsaPassportStamper
Reviews.Content: This is truly the worst value I have ever gotten for my lodging dollars. Yes, the location is excellent, right in the heart of the old town. But location is not enough to justify a night here. When we checked in the teeny tiny elevator was broken. Our room is on the 4th floor. It is 90 degrees out (and in the stairwell). By the time we lugged our bags up 4 flights we were soaked in sweat. Upon entering our room, we found it was also 92 degrees inside. We cranked the AC and left for dinner. 4 hours later it had only dropped to 82! What a miserable sweaty night. We are young fit people who can easily climb stairs in heat. I cannot imagine what a couple of 80 year olds would have done?? Gone elsewhere I guess. They front desk clerk seemed blase to anyones difficulty. Could we store our bags for the day before our cruise? Sure, we were welcome to throw them in a wide open hallway where anyone can walk away with them. Gee thanks. This place is not even trying. You are better off somewhere in the city and take a cab to the old town. $110 for this dump? No way.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money”
Reviews.Author: pecangirl
Reviews.Content: Where to begin....we arrived at this HOJO after a cruise. We chose it for the fantastic location. That's the ONLY positive I could find! Negatives: Arrived to check in and were told we could check in MAYBE at 2pm, but for sure by 3pm. So we walked around a bit and at 4pm we STILL couldn't check in. Why? Because the floors were wet. This is hilarious, because.... There was no water. Period. Apparently a water main had broken in Old San Juan and the water had been out for over 24 hours at this point. No water = no toilet, no shower, no toothbrushing etc. The water never went back on during our stay (24 hours later). Other hotels in the area had back-up systems so their guests had working toilets, showers etc...We were told this happens frequently in Old San Juan and most other businesses have a back up water system. This dump did not, nor were we offered any solutions or refund for our inconvenience. The room was muggy and hot and the A/C was LOUD. Elevator was not working No free continental breakfast Lightbulbs in room were either burnt out of hanging from socket. Front desk staff not helpful. And we were told the General Mgr was aware of the problem and would be there soon to solve the issues. Never happened. My credit card was charged $50- though I didn't authorize this and had pre-paid a month previous the entire amount of the stay. The charge was refunded the following day (upon checkout) when the front desk clerk informed me of the charge. We would have never checked in and gone elsewhere had we not pre-paid for our room. Believe me, we wanted to! Don't waste your time or money with this place. There are numerous other comparable places in the area....pick one of them. I can provide photos if you'd like! PS- Still no refund even after complaining to HOJO Corporate. Guess they don't care!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for acrobats and handymans”
Reviews.Author: superbot
Reviews.Content: The story begins on Labor Day weekend. My girlfriend and I decided to indulge in all the wonderful things Puerto Rico has to offer. Unfortunately, we chose to stay at the Howard Johnson Plaza de Armas. Big mistake. The price is alluring, but after you read the rest of this review, I hope you will look elsewhere. I am not one to complain. I have stayed in no frills hotels in the past and was not expecting much when I checked into the HoJo. But this place is an orgy of aggravation. We selected a suite room so we would have a window. I guess the definition of a suite at the HoJo means handyman's special with the following "amenities": 1. Running toilet that would not flush 2. Safe locked rendering it useless 3. Phone not working 4. Television with only two channels 5. Broken iron 6. Inconsistent water temperature 7. And last but not least, no control of AC that does not really work anyway. The first room we checked into had all the problems listed above. When we opened the door we were greeted by a blast of oven temperature heat. Apparently it is normal for the HoJo staff to have the AC turned off when the room is not occupied and it is 100 degrees outside. That means the temperature in the room would stay in the 90s for at least your first day as the AC catches up. Just turning on the AC is a feat of acrobatics. The unit is situated at the ceiling level, 10 feet above the floor. There are no wall controls or remote control to the unit. To activate, you must climb on chairs or nightstands to reach the controls. The room was equipped with a ceiling fan which we thought would alleviate the sweltering heat, until we discovered that the ceiling lights must be on for the ceiling fan to operate. They were both on the same circuit. This means that you have to sleep with the lights on if you decide to use the ceiling fan. The next morning we woke up exhausted if you can consider tossing and turning in 90 degree heat sleep. Our first stop was the front desk. We inquired about the AC control and were informed that the controller was missing, without any further explanation. We also mentioned the toilet was not working. The front desk staff told us we could change rooms if we wanted to which we agreed to. Later that day we returned to the hotel, we inquired about the room status, and the front desk staff assigned us to a new room comparable to the suite we were paying for. We eagerly moved our luggage to the new room expecting to finally start our vacation only to be greeted with all the same "amenities" listed above in a smaller room with no ceiling fan option. The first thing I want to mention about this room is the more challenging acrobatics required to operate the AC unit. Do not attempt this if you are faint of heart, disabled or elderly. Climbing onto the top of a seven foot armoire is necessary to access the AC controls. Unfortunately, we prepaid the room so we could not get a refund if we checked out. Trust us, we really wanted to check out. After analyzing our plight we decided to stay the additional nights we paid for and then move to another hotel. The only way we could sleep in the oppressive heat was by purchasing a pedestal fan at the local drugstore. The fan helped us stay cooler, but it did not keep the cockroaches away. We found a jumbo size cockroach in our room the next morning. What a wonderful way to awake. I can go on forever about how disappointing this hotel is. Save your money, save your time, spare yourself the aggravation and book a different hotel. After checking out of the HoJo, we checked into the Sheraton two blocks away. That is when our vacation really began. P.S. If you decide to stay at the HoJo, do not waste any time waiting for the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Better nearby”
Reviews.Author: mack243SouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Toilet Overflowed ; coffie maker broken; no windows; elevator small& slow; remote broken. Found other hotels that people enjoyed at similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Slow elevator would not stop me from staying again”
Reviews.Author: TriviaFanatics
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the nght before a cruise. We had heard about the slow elevator and rooms with no windows so my wife made sure we had a window. Personally we thought the elevator was quaint and since we only used it to bring our bags up to the room one day, and down the next it was not a problem. However, I can understand if anyone with a mobility problem may not want to stay here. The stairs were also rather steep and narrow. I was unpleasantly surprised that breakfast was not included, the 'restaurant' if you can call it that, which is actually inside the hotel is nothing to write home about. But it was fine for one meal, and we had a nice visit with some other travellers. The location of course is great. Since we did not have a car the lack of parking some other people mentioned was not an issue. The location is the best thing about this hotel. The A/C was a bit loud but we did not have any problems with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your money”
Reviews.Author: darthvaderpr
Reviews.Content: I booked on this hotel based on the reviews. Some people talked trash about this hotel. I agree with them in some aspects. First, this hotel does not have a parking lot. You have to pay if you want a safe parking spot. Second, no pool. If you want to take a dip, ditto on this one. Third, the rooms are very small and some of them do not have windows (I was unlucky I got one). Fourth, no restaurant, just a small bar and NO complimentary breakfast included. For $92.50 (taxes included), I think it is VERY EXPENSIVE. I give a couple of positive stars because of the staff. They are very helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever.”
Reviews.Author: latinchica
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in a lot of not-so-luxe hotels, especially in Central America, but this one gets the prize for bad, bad, bad. The room was filthy. Phone, safe, and TV didn't work. AC did, though, since it sounded like a truck every time the compressor came on, we finally turned it off. Had booked 2 nights in advance, but checked out after one night. Almost left at 3 in the morning, since we weren't sleeping anyway. Don't let the location lure you into staying here--MUCH better accommodations available nearby. We ended up at the lovely Hotel El Convento for our second night in San Juan and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, Hot, Customer Service from Hell, Will be closed soon.”
Reviews.Author: SunnyCorleone
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst hotel expereince I have ever had. Could not wait to leave. Really bad customer service, hot rooms, poor bathrooms, Staff were sneaky and deceptive about a couple issues. Gives the real Howard Johnsons in the states a bad name. Supposedly owned by Wyndham...and giving them a really bad rap. Shame on Wyndham. I felt like it was a third world facility. I wouldnt stay there again if you gave it to me for free. My prediction is that they will be closed in the not too distant future because of all of the above. I truly feel it is my duty to inform you. Do not waste your money. Spend the extra bucks and go to a Sheraton only a few blocks away. You wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, great location”
Reviews.Author: NanbLasVegas
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried after reviews but pleased with stay. I was using for a post cruise day and hotel let you leave luggage in the am free, it is not locked up but kept in a back room location. I did request a bottom floor and room was better than I expected. While small it had plenty of room, short hallway with door into very nice bathroom/shower, twin bed with small desk at the foot of bed. Not fancy but bed was comfortable and pillow not as bad as some of the reviews (although I did have my own in case). Air condition was not as loud as feared and kept the room very pleasant. Since I was expecting very little I was pleased, sort of like staying at Grandma's house in her back room:) Location can't be beat with free trolley stop at the door, I started out a bit nervous at getting lost when I realized all I had to do was look for a trolley sign no matter where I was and I would be dropped off at the door. Great place. Staff very friendly. Highly recommend Segway tour of Old San Juan if you get a chance, great fun.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: LivingFabulously
Reviews.Content: I called on a Friday and booked for the following night, a Saturday night stay. After waiting in the lobby for two hours till the 3:00 check in on Saturday, i was told that my reservation was not in their records. It turned out they accidentally booked me for the previous day in their system (for the day i called). The clerk admitted the error and said i'd be refunded. After returning home and checking my credit card statement i saw the charge had not been refunded. I called the hotel and was told that the charge would be refunded and to look out for it in a couple days. After not seeing it refunded after a week, i called again and then was told to take it up with my credit card company because i could not prove i called the hotel initially. The clerk was completely insensitive and was quite mean and i would never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but you get what you pay for...buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: berlam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights prior to a cruise and 1 night following the cruise. We chose this hotel because of its location in "Old San Juan" and what appeared to be a reasonable price. We had asked for and received one of their better rooms.......a room with a balcony and queen size bed. When we arrived, we immediately noticed the room safe did not work, there was no hot water and when we went to call the front desk, we discovered the phone was not working. After a trip to the front desk, we were advised the phones had not worked for several weeks due to a power outage?? Their answer for the safe was that the battery was probably weak or dead however they then did not fix?? As to the hot water, they suggested we "fiddle with the tap". Eventually after several attempts, we did get some warm water out of the shower....we never did get any warm/hot water in the sink. The hotel is very old and it is apparent that it is not maintained. The elevator holds either 4 adults or 2 adults with luggage and is painfully slow....many people including ourselves used the stairs vs waiting for the elevator. The general appearance is that it is dirty although on a positive note, the sheets appeared to be clean and the mattress reasonably comfortable. The room was air conditioned but the noise from the air conditioner caused one to debate whether or not to turn it on at night when you're trying to sleep. The windows had no glass.....only wooden shutters and the street was busy all night so between the air conditioner and the street noise, sleep was hard to get. Oh, by the way, over the doors to the rooms there are wooden slats so you hear everything happening in the hallway which adds to the noise factor. As an aside, we went to go out the front door of the hotel one night. The desk manager was looking at a valve just outside their front door but on hotel property as it bubbled up raw sewage onto the side walk which then ran into the street. That was pretty disgusting and you had no choice but to walk over it to either exit or enter the hotel. By the time we got back to the hotel later that evening, the valve was closed and it appeared they had "washed down" the side walk but the sewage was still in the street. If we hadn't prepaid for these rooms, I would have left after seeing the room for the first time. It seemed to be too much of a hassle to look for another room and try to get our money back from Howard Johnson. Would I stay here again...........definitely not!! It would be worth it to me to pay the extra $50/night to stay at one of the other hotels in the city. Would I recommend this hotel to friends/family or others......definitely not!!!

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping in a broom closet with a jet engine”
Reviews.Author: jamaicatrip2
Reviews.Content: In all of our many years of traveling this was a first--a room with absolutely no window. Yes just a small drab airless chamberâ€”yet interestingly mosquitos were still able to make their way in. First they put us (a couple) in a room with one twin bed. No phone in the room so my husband had to go to the desk to straighten that out --in doing so he discovered that the elevator takes approximately 35 seconds between floors---each trip up or down was excruciatingly slow. Once in a room (with 2 twin beds) we turned on the air conditioner â€”it was unbelieveably loud. If there had been a fire or earthquake we would be definately be trapped in. Realising this made for an uneasy night's sleep considering that Haiti had just had a horrible earthquake that day. This we learned not from the TV--it didn't have any reception--but from the car radio. If you drive by car it is a slow slog through badly marked streets to find, there is no area to pull over in the front (we almost got a ticket from the police as we unloaded the car) Check out was very slow, over a half an hour in a long line. The records were not on a computer but in paper work that the clerk had to shuffle through, he was clearly overwhelmed. In line I chatted with the other guests, several had rooms on the front that had windows that looked out over the plaza... be sure to ask for them. They also informed us that they got an over 55 discount but when we asked for it the clerk plead ignorance. We thought the plaza outside the hotel was fun. It was decorated for the holidays and active with families, a few harmless bums and many tourists. It had some stores, a grocery and a drug store. There are many good restaurants nearby --we liked La Bombonera for breakfast. For diner we ate at a great place --can't recall the name but it was across from the plaza with a statue of LaSalle and the words " creative Carribean cusine" was under the title.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, and great location”
Reviews.Author: dansun82
Reviews.Content: My title says it all. Nothing fancy at this hotel, but it delivered where it counts the most. We were in San Juan for a weekend excursion and this place fit the bill. Great price, and great location to drive from. We rented a car and drove everywhere. A bit hard to ge around since road signs aren't Puerto Rico's strong point, but all in all, it was a great trip and a great stay at the HoJo. Make sure you visit the forts in old San Juan, and take a trip to Senor Frog's!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: greecer
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this location, right on the Plaza de Armas. We stayed here one night prior to our cruise. There was a festival with live band on the Plaza, so there were lots of people, and the band was very loud. We stayed for awhile, then went to our interior room, glad we did not have a room facing the street. You could hear the band in the hallway, but not in the room. The big problem was the a/c. It was EXTREMELY loud, and bothered both of us all night. Mounted high on the wall, we did not see the control which was lower on the wall, or we may have tried to turn it off and see if we could stand the heat. It did keep the room cool however. The room safe was not working, seemed due to a dead battery as there was no display, so the staff removed the $1.50 daily charge for the safe. Room was pretty small, and flattest pillows I have ever seen in my life. Decor was okay. Skip the continental breakfast, we had great difficulty talking to the waitress and getting what we wanted. Juice was packaged, and tasted spoiled, so we left it. Danish were packaged too, and dry and tasteless. We did get some white toast too, and coffee, but no refills. There is a McDonalds right off the plaza where you could grab a quick breakfast, or stop at a bakery, would be better choices. Reception staff were extremely friendly, spoke great English, and very helpful. They also stored our luggage at no charge the next morning while we went to sight see before boarding our ship. I'm not sure I would stay here again, maybe try the Milano or another budget option, mainly due to the loud a/c.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lgjp2631
Reviews.Content: very nice staff, helpful. went out of the way to help us with information and traveling tips. hotel was very clean. most of the rooms are really small with no windows. it was hard getting up in the morning with no natural light coming into the room. good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HOTEL and worst customer service I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Hollyanne05
Reviews.Content: First, let me start by saying I read a million reviews and did my research before booking a room for our trip to Puerto Rico. We were on a pre-wedding trip to meet wedding planner, photographer and to visit the Caribe Hilton which is where the wedding will be held. We also wanted to stay somewhere relatively inexpensive and centrally located so we could sight-see as much as possible in between all the appointments. The location is great if you want to stay in Old San Juan. I would much rather stay in a resort or different area for vacation but this was perfect for just a "place to sleep" I had no expectations of the hotel being a resort, or having any extra amenities. My connections in PR told me the hotel was clean and in a good location which is all I was looking for. That being said, this by far the worst room I've ever stayed at, and the worst service I've ever encountered in my life. We had to switch rooms right off the bat because I did not feel safe on the first floor. The door opened right almost on top of the bed, the bathroom sink was in the actual room, the pillows were the thickness of a magazine, the towels barely wrapped around me and I am 5 ft 110 pounds. The shower was so small I could barely fit. All of this, however, we just laughed at and I took the blame for booking the room. It served it's purpose, and was just a place to sleep--although you couldn't really sleep there since the whole place echoed and you could hear everything in the hallway,lobby, or outside. The building is old and neat, could be a really neat hotel if taken care of. The part I had a major problem with is that our key never worked, from day one. After a rainy, hot muggy day of walking around and dragging our bags everywhere, we would return to our hotel to climb the narrow, hot stairway 3 flights to our room (the elevator is old, scary, and takes 20 minutes to get to the 3rd floor, and is so tiny two of us couldn't really fit), only to find that our key would not work and we would have to go down and get someone. It got to the point where we would ask someone to follow us up to our room in case our key wouldn't work. We went through 11 keys total and whoever was at the front desk was always frustrated and panicked and couldnt' get ahold of anyone to help. We are pretty easy going people and were never rude to them, by the way. The last night we were there, we had made a point to get back at a reasonable hour after dinner since we had to get up at 5 am to go to the airport. Of course, our key did not work, and hours later the poor desk guy couldn't get the master key, the housekeeping keys, or even a huge long hanger looking tool to open our room. No manager, supervisor, etc was available or on-call. Which I felt was very unsafe. What if there was a child in the room that you went downstairs to get a bottle of water for and couldn't get back in the room? He offered us another key to another room like that could help at all considering all of our luggage was in our room. Finally, as the desk guy was downstairs frantically trying to call someone, my fiance managed to jimmy open our door with the hanger thing (much like a car) after laying on the filthy floor for an hour trying to make it work. He got the number to the owner and supervisor and was basically told by the owner it wasn't his problem, there was nothing he could do about it, and to leave his complaint in writing. No apology for the severe inconvenience of a customer actually having to break into their own room, or for the fact that we had about 4 hours at that point until we needed to go to the airport. Completely unbelievable, for ANYONE"S standards. I am surprised they are still in business, the guy working even told us this wasn't right for us, or for him, and that it happened all the time. I realize there is a different "mentality" or way of doing business on an island, etc etc. However, there is no excuse for this kind of treatment or customer service and we will be filing several complaints with whoever we can find to do so. And the Caribe Hilton Resort is AMAZING, as are many of the other hotels in the area to stay at. Do not even waste your money or time on this place.

Reviews.Title: “The best and friendliest hotel in OSJ”
Reviews.Author: Salty_Wench
Reviews.Content: The Howard Johnson (formally the Plaza de Armas) is by far the best hotel to be found in OSJ. It is located at the original Plaza and within a few blocks of literally all the museums and the Fort. It is also just across the plaza from 2 drug stores and the grocery store. Very convienant for all those forgotten items. The hotel is also away from the SOHO district (South Fortaleza Street) where most of the restaurants and bars are located. Unless you are young, after dinner most of us enjoy leaving that scene. The best rooms in the hotel are the middle suites that have a balcony that you can go out to people watch, read or just relax after walking around all day. The hotel offers a free continental breakfast ranging from bagels, cereals, pastries, etc. Their small bar fronting San Jose Street is cozy and offers 2-1 in the evening happy hour. Best of all was the staff. They did everything possible to make us happy and comfortable and their hospitality made our stay not only enjoyable but secured a return trip from us.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic, well-located budget accommodations”
Reviews.Author: ViajeraParaSiempre
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for flexible visitors who want a central location and don't care about being pampered. The staff is friendly, the rooms excellently clean, the beds comfortable. Yes, the a/c is noisy, but plentiful, and the transom over the door lets in too much light at night. Lots of hot water. The elevator is a pain in the neck, so ask for the first floor. The price is right for budget travelers, and the basic amenities are all there. Don't expect turn-down service or bell-boy assistance. My one major complaint was that the housekeeping staff repeatedly ignored Do Not Disturb signs on the door. That was cause for some complaints to the desk on my part. On the other hand, I was quickly given another room when the a/c failed in my first room. And an overcharge of $3 was quickly removed from my bill. It's not a honeymoon hotel, but just right for the seasoned traveler who is interested more in location than luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location . . . perfect for one night pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Firefighterjake
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on the night before our cruise took off from Port. This hotel provided everything we wanted -- it was within a 10-minute (all down-hill) walk to the Carnival Cruise Line pier, it was affordable and right in middle of Old San Juan's historic locations which meant you could easily walk to the various sites or take the free trolley. The rooms were clean and comfortably furnished. Breakfast was a no-frills continental breakfast. The staff was wicked friendly. We stayed in one of the rooms without a window . . . which meant it was extremely quiet. Even though there was plenty of folks out on the Plaza we didn't hear a thing and slept quite soundly after our long plane trip. The absolute best part of this hotel is its proximity to the fortresses, pier and the old world architecture of Old San Juan. Another plus for would-be cruisers is that the hotel secured our luggage after check out . . . which meant we could check out, spend some time touring Old San Juan and then return several hours later to collect our bags and head to the pier to embark on the ship.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: travellerMinnesota
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on our way to Guanica. We had an impossible time trying to find it as we asked people where the Howard Johnson's was. We had a rental car and finally parked it in a parking garage, which was very cheap. We walked for a long time and people were very friendly, but no one knew what we were talking about even when we showed them a map. So ask about the Plaza de Armas-then everyone knows where that is. We got there very late at night and the night manager was fabulous. We stayed up for a couple of hours and wished that we could have stayed up longer as we loved sitting on the Plaza watching all of the action. There was a wonderful coffee kiosk right on the Plaza. The only problem I had was that the room had no windows, and I was totally claustrophobic. The breakfast was adequate and I took it and ate out on the Plaza. We were anxious to get going to Guanica, but I wish that we had explored Old San Juan more as it is fascinating. The traffic from the airport to Old San Juan was a nightmare, but we were there on Valentine's night as well as a holiday-President's Day. The hotel is a great location if you don't mind a hotel with no windows.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Lovinthesunn
Reviews.Content: This HoJo is realistically a 2 star property, based on room quality and decorum. I was quite happy for what we paid and what we got. I was realistic in what I expected going to a HoJo in Puerto Rico though. We got a Kind bed "suite" (I assume is probably just a bigger room) which had doors and balcony that opened onto the main road below. Beware though that while we didn't have problems sleeping with all the noise (we were wearing ear plugs), friends of ours only slept for about 2hrs b/c of the noise. There was some crazy guy outside having a fit with himself all night long. The hotel is in a great location, we walked all around no problems to the forts and the cruise pier we were leaving out of was @ 10min walk away. We chose to get a cab @12usd though rather than dragging our luggage all around the cobblestone streets. Old San Juan is a beautiful area and I just wish we had more time there to explore. The continental breakfast is just that, toast and jam (no pb), 2 cereal choices, danishes, coffee and juice. Great restaurants in the area, there's one a few blocks away that invented the pina coloda...yum! Also great shopping as for name brands etc... Oh and they say the elevator is small...it is extremely small. You can probably fit 4 adults in it and that's it. It was faster to take the small staircase up to the third floor while walking very slowly than the elevator:) All part of the charm though!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this hotel--great location!”
Reviews.Author: mitswan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights before our cruise left port. We loved how historic it is. The rooms are modest in size, but who in staying in Old San Juan to sit in their room?? It is located in the heart of all the Old San Juan nightlife, shopping and historic architecture. We walked to both of the historic forts, all our street wandering to view historic buildings and could not have had a better time. The shower had plenty of hot water for all four of us (2 people in 2 rooms), no bugs, really no complaints about property at all. We did take the stairs up the 4 flights to our room after riding elevator to take suitcases up the first time. The elevator is a historic one and a bit small--but soooooo cool. It is slow based on fact they can't replace it with modern one according to historic building codes. But it was fun the few times we took it--just took a bit longer than walking the stairs. Staff was friendly and helpful with directions or recommendations. We all would stay in this hotel again--can't wait to go back and enjoy Old San Juan again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “For 1 Night Only”
Reviews.Author: dkbray
Reviews.Content: Well- true to the reviews the HoJo has cheap, clean rooms with loud air conditioners. Because there is no window to open you have to use the AC. Location is excellent for Old San Juan so if you are just staying for one night I would say go for it, but this hotel is pretty much just for sleeping. There is an ok lounge area on the first floor for relaxing or reading and the people who work there are nice. As for the free breakfast- treat yourself to a Mallorca at Cafe Bombonera instead of eating in the hotel. Delicious!

Reviews.Title: “modest hotel, good people and location”
Reviews.Author: mnjcruisers
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for an over-night stay to give us some time in old San Juan before and after our cruise. The location worked out well as this hotel is at Plaza de Armas in the heart of old San Juan. The rooms we had were small but clean and (as some said) the air conditioning can be noisy but not unbearably so. As we stayed only one night on each occasion the small rooms were o.k. but I would look for something larger were I to stay for a few days. The front desk staff were very good. They directed to us to some wonderful restaurants. Also, as non-Americans we were not aware of this, but they advised us on our departure that we would have to go through Agriculture Department screening at the airport. This proved very useful information as the screening is a real bottleneck. We saw several individuals who had tried to check in without the screening being forced to go back to the screening queue which by then had grown considerably.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: ctelly22
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here Memorial day weekend for one night prior to our cruise. I found the hotel to be nice and well maintained, did not notice any bugs. The elevator was slow, but it worked. We had a king suite. While the room was somewhat small it was nice, clean and the balcony was an added extra. The hotel is in a great location, right by Plaza de Armas, and the free trolley stops right in front. The location is great for walking around Old San Juan. The continental breakfast was also an added extra. The only thing I disliked were the long lines to check in. They strictly adhere to the check in time. So if you get there early you won't get a room, but they will hold your luggage. Besides that I found the staff to be extremely helpful and accommodating. This was a great place to stay for way under $100 per night. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: papi1096
Reviews.Content: The Good. 1) Location, 2) Price 3) Clean, although we did find some dead flying roaches in the common areas, This is normal in the Carribean. 4) Free continental Breakfast 5) Friendly staff The Bad 1) Small room 2) Noisy A/C unit (not unbearable) 3) No windows in our room. This bld is a couple of hundred years old. Was not originally build as a hotel. I believe it was some type of warehouse. 4) No parking ( public parking 3 blocks away) 5) No swimming pool ( even a kiddy pool on the roof would have been suffice.) 6) No beaches in Old San Juan ( 15 min cab ride $20 fare each way to the nearest public beach. I think that we could have used public transportation but did't inquire.) 6) tiny elevator ( we used the tiny stairs). I have stayed in many diffrent hotels in Old San Juan over the years. Must admit that this one provides the most value for the money. If it had at least a springler where you could refresh after a long hot day it would be one of my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: scp427
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here before going to a smaller island. We wanted to explore Old San Juan & the forts. The location of this hotel is great. The staff was very accomodating. Our room was quite large. We had a king suite in the front overlooking the plaza. It was noisy at night but didn't keep us up with the air on. The staff put a twin mattress in the room the 2nd night for our daughter. The lobby decor needs updating as well as the front of the hotel. Other than that it was great. It was a good place to sleep & centrally located so we could stop back there during the day while exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to crash . . .”
Reviews.Author: Bug3
Reviews.Content: I found the Howard Johnson Inn at Plaza de Armas to be exactly as expected, based on these reviews. It was very clean and my singe-bed room was surprisingly large - although it had no window. I had no problems with noise. My room was impressively clean and well taken care of. The staff at the front desk was efficient and business-like. . . not particularly friendly. The free breakfast was simply a nicer continental breakfast -- nothing hot. The location was EXCELLENT. I paid only $100 for my room and was satisfied because I was there for only 5-6 hours of sleep. I would be reluctant to pay $160+ to stay because this hotel is simply a clean place to sleep and to be in the middle of the action. I believe there are other, nicer, more authentic and unique, places to stay in Old San Juan once you reach the $180+ range. There are a couple of reserved parking spots right in front of the hotel for loading and unloading. Otherwise, parking is very difficult on the streets around the hotel. However, once you drop off your luggage, there are several parking garages within close proximity (approx. 5 blocks). DONT try to carry your luggage from the car garages -- the sidewalks and streets are cobble-stone, are VERY narrow and are filled with lots of people.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE noise throughout the night...worst ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: worldhopperFlorida
Reviews.Content: Don't even think about staying here if you value your sleep. The noise levels throughout the night were TORTURE. Hall light streamed into the room through a window above the door- so I was left to try and sleep with bright lights and noise every night. Phone in the room didn't work and water was never hot, just lukewarm, and rooms don't have windows...but these were the least of my concerns. I've stayed in hostels in rooms with 15 drunk people with less noise... this hotel does have a fantastic location and the breakfast is fine and rooms tidy. Is it worth it? You couldn't pay me to stay here again. In short, AWFUL.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: bgsualum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Howard Johnson Inn Plaza de Armas for one night (last weekend) prior to leaving on a cruise. We basically needed a place to sleep and shower, so we weren't concerned about amenities. What we loved about this hotel was the fact that our two kids could have separate beds. Our spacious room had a king, a single, and a futon. Perfect arrangement for our family. We also had a fridge and a microwave. Everything was clean and the bathroom was clean and spacious, as well. We were at the top of the (very narrow) staircase on the second floor, so we didn't really bother using the elevator, which appeared to be so slow that it was almost stopped. I don't think we would've found the hotel on our own, so I'm glad the taxi driver knew where it was. As previous reviewers have noted, it's just a little storefront tucked in between two other stores. It's tall and skinny. We arrived early and were unable to check in. Though it seemed as though we waited forever (we had to remember that we were now on "caribbean time"), the guy at the front desk was very helpful. He stored our luggage and gave us some recommendations for lunch while we waited for our room to be ready. When we returned an hour later, our room was ready and we were able to check in. The location is great for getting anywhere in Old San Juan. We walked to El Morro and then around the rest of the city. When we got back to the hotel several hours later, we were thrilled to find a Pizza Hut right around the corner. We weren't that hungry... just needed to eat and get some sleep. That brings me to our only real complaint about the hotel. Our room faced the street and there seemed to be a lot of traffic until the wee hours of the morning. In San Juan, as in most Caribbean places we've been, this includes a lot of horn honking. While this didn't seem to affect our two kids, my husband and I had a less than stellar night's sleep. The complimentary breakfast was simple, but adequate. The water pressure in the shower was great. And once again, the hotel stored our luggage while we wandered around as we had to check out before we could go to the cruise ship. We were credited the fee for the room safe as we didn't use it. And with the AAA rate, the room was more than reasonable for being in the center of Old San Juan. We would definitely stay there again. If you're looking for an upscale, resort-type place, this isn't the hotel for you. However, if you're looking for a clean, convenient place to stay in Old San Juan, definitely put this Howard Johnson on your short list!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be scared off by the reviews-a good deal”
Reviews.Author: WAgal
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for staying overnight before or after a cruise. We needed a room with 4 beds to accomodate two children, ages 6 and 10. I was a little nervous after reading the comments on the cockroaches (and there are lots of them in PR!), but there was not a single cockroach in sight.. We knew that we were arriving late and leaving by noon, so we were willing to take the chance. We were arriving Christmas Day, so I did not have high expectations on service, figuring everyone was off. The desk manager was very helpful pointing to a place for a 10 pm snack for us and kids. We had a room facing the street with two window/balconies on the second floor (room 206 I think, labled "home office" on the door). Yes, the elevator is old (the kind you have to close the cage and door for it to move), but we were on the 2nd floor, so we didn't need it much. The room was not the most quiet, but the air conditioner makes enough noise to drown out most of the street noise. I wake at the slightest sound, and only a couple of honks early in the morning were enough to wake me. It was a huge room, with lots of space for our 4 large suitcases. It's clearly an older building, but honestly, the most noticable part was the worn/scuffed tiles in the hallway. Once in our room, there were new, clean tiles, a clean bath, and lots of space. There was a king, a twin, and a sofa that folded down into a twin. I have to warn you that the sofa looked to be about 5 ft long with wide padded arms (about 12 inches each), so when the back folds down, it worked for my tall 6 year old, but at 5' 7", I would have been hanging ontothe arms which were not entirely flat with the bed.. There were no sheets ready when we arrived, but the front desk quickly located them, and I made up the bed myself. Almost across the street from this hotel is a plaza square, which had a lovely espresso/bakery kiosk, which was open on Christmas day evening. We slept through the breakfast provided by the hotel, but there is a fast food joint within 1/2 block that was perfectly adequate for breakfast. There is also a Wendy's in the same block. We loved that it was a 10 min walk to the old fortress of San Juan, and the front desk gave us a walking map and good directions. The waterfront is also in easy walking distance, but we did not have time. The cab ride to the cruise terminal was about 10 min. All in all, it was a great price compared to the other options for 4 of us, but I'm not sure I would have put an adult in the sofa bed. One last note: I booked directly though the hotel, and when I went to confirm, they thought we had 3 persons instead of 4. They were able to confirm us a room for 4, but I was under the impressions that I was getting a King Plus room, which was a king and two twins, We ended up with a king, twin and small sofa bed, which worked for us but not if our children had been bigger. Still, a good value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable and Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: lifesaver1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights while doing some work for a nonprofit. The primary pluses are location and cost. It is in the center of Old San Juan, on a nice little plaza. A full grocery store is one block away. The hotel serves a breakfast in the morning that includes fruit, cereal, etc., served on paper plates. Nothing great, but not terrible either. The hotel is apparently in an old apartment building converted to this purpose. Rooms: You will want a room with a queen size bed or larger. Our group found smaller beds in other rooms that were unacceptable, even for one person. There are no windows in most rooms (except those facing the street). The rooms are very quiet, especially since there is an air conditioner in each room. Rooms are reasonably spacious and wi-fi is included at no cost. Elevator: There is a single elevator that moves at a speed of about one minute per floor (literally). This is a four story building. If you have no problem walking up and down stairs, you will use the cramped staircase instead of the elevator. If you need to use an elevator, you are going to have frustrations. Depending on your physical condition, a lower floor might be desirable. Staff: We found the staff to be quite pleasant and helpful. Overall, this seems to be a hotel used primarily by cruise ship passengers for a single night stay on one end or the other. So long as you are not looking for luxury and have no problem with stairs, the hotel is quite acceptable. If you intend to spend any meaningful amount of time in the room or hotel, you will find it a bit dreary, but a bargain. We did not encounter issues of cleanliness mentioned elsewhere, but this is not a corporate hotel, so one could expect variations.

Reviews.Title: “Think again before staying here!”
Reviews.Author: theaudg
Reviews.Content: I had booked one night at this hotel after a Caribbean cruise. Itâ€™s in a great location of old San Juan, with plenty of shops, restaurants and right next to the Plaza de Armas. At first glance it seemed like a great place. I booked two rooms on separate floors and was shocked that both rooms contained beds with hairs. Thatâ€™s right- multiple hairs in both rooms!!! They blamed their linen service company then changed the sheets; even so it was no excuse. One room had a balcony that over looked the city. On this balcony were ashtrays packed with cigarette butts as well as a dead cockroach by the door. Walked into the hallway, another dead cockroach!!!??? I couldnâ€™t believe that these rooms were serviced by house keeping and left in this condition, especially after reading the good reviews. The best part was that I found a vacancy at another hotel, and that the Howard Johnson willingly refunded all of my money. It was such a shame for what a great location this hotel has. It may have just been a fluke that we had a bad experience with this hotel, so buyers beware...

Reviews.Title: “We Looooved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suntanrussian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night after our cruise. We decided to select this one after just reading a few reviews. After 7 days of cruising, we decided that we wanted something with no windows or phones. It was more that we expected. We were literally in the heart of Old San Juan. We didn't have windows, but they did install a phone. The people at the hotel were wonderful. If you needed anything at all they were excellent at helping out. For instance... Our boat docked at 7am, and we were trying to decide what to do with our luggage. My husband suggested that we just go to the hotel. Well upon letting the staff know that we were quite early they told us not to worry about it and stored our luggage. They gave us a map of the area and we ended up at Forts of Old San Juan. We literally were able to walk to both Forts and take a tour through the mines. By the time we had finished and had lunch it was well past 3pm. Everything is in walking distance and the people there speak english quite well. Thank you all the staff at The Howard Johnson Inn Plaza. We will never forget our one night stay. My next visit to your hotel will be longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly unique”
Reviews.Author: youandme_03
Reviews.Content: I expected the hotel to be like all the other stock hotels you see around, but it was surprisingly individual. It's owned locally and licensed under the Howard Johnson name, but it hasn't lost its unique touch. The rooms aren't ritzy, but the convenient location makes it so worth it. It's a fabulous location if you want to bum around Old San Juan--it's right next to tons of great food and within walking distance of the sights. (Old San Juan, by the way, is absolutely lovely.) The hotel was a good price and breakfast was included. Really, there's nowhere else to stay in Old San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location: Best Location in old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: fridakalo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel two nights prior taking a cruise and one night after our cruise. There were six of us traveling, so we booked three rooms. All of us agreed that this hotel met our expectations. The best thing about this hotel is the location. Every thing there was within walking distance. There are two pharmacies across the street. There are a lot of souvenir stores, the house were the pina colada was born (Barrachina) was around the block. There are a lot of restaurants close by. We went to Jibaritos, a puerto rican restaurant, located about six blocks from there. Continental breakfast was included so that was very convenient for us. The elevator from the hotel is more than 100 years old!!! It was very tiny and slow; so we used the tiny stairs all the time...if you don't like to use the stairs or have a lot of lugagge ask for a room on the first floor. The people at the lobby were very friendly and polite. There are no phones on the rooms but since we all had our cell phones we didn't care. The rooms had no windows but that did not bother any of us. The rooms were clean, and we felt safe all the time. If you would like to be close to the beach then this is not the hotel you need. If you want a good location to explore the old San Juan within walking distance at a reasonable price; then I would recomend you this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCitygal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an ideal location in Old San Juan. The Plaza is a great spot for people watching, meeting locals, and getting some coffee. The big problem with Old San Juan for me was that there aren't very many street signs on the buildings at intersections, so often times you really don't have a clue what street you're on. After driving in and out of Old San Juan though, you start to figure it out (it's not that big an area). This is an old colonial building converted in to a hotel. That means most of the rooms don't have windows because the houses had windows in the front and back to allow air to pass through the house and cool it down. Side rooms didn't have windows. I guess the door were just left open. If you want a room with a view, don't stay here. If you want a large room, this isn't the place to stay. If you want someplace to rest your head at night, this will do just fine. The air conditioner in my room sounded like, well, an air conditioner. If you're used to very high end central air conditioning that makes nary a sound, I suppose you might find it noisy. If you're used to the sound a window air conditioner makes (white noise), you'll be perplexed by the negative comments left by others about the sound the AC makes. The continental breakfast offered is decent, and should be taken advantage of (pastries, cereal, fruit, toast, juice, coffee). The staff is friendly and helpful, and made sure we knew which parking garage had the best rates (thank goodness! There was a big difference!). The elevator did break down one day while I was there, and it's slow, but it's not like it takes 10 minutes to get between floors. This is hardly unusual at a hotel in a building that was built before elevators were even invented (stay at any old converted hotel in Paris, and this elevator will seem like heaven by comparison). The staff gladly helped my travel companion with her bag the day the elevator was broken. I would describe the hotel decor in the lobby and lounge area as "Pottery Barn." And I rather liked the tile work in the lobby. If I were to stay in Old San Juan again, I would definitely stay here. Compared to the prices of other hotels, this was definitely the best deal I found. If your focus during a vacation is getting out and enjoying the sites and culture, and want your hotel to be safe and comfortable but not the focus of your stay, this is a good option for you.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little extra and stay some where else.”
Reviews.Author: rr0001
Reviews.Content: The room decor was nice. The room was small and windowless but that was expected. The AC system was the worst I have experienced. The unit was extremely loud and totally enclosed in the the room. Instead of exhausting the hot air outside it was blown into the drop ceiling of the bathroom. Made the bathroom feel like a sauna. Even ear plugs did not adequately damped the noise of the almost constantly running AC unit.

Reviews.Title: “Dreary, Moldy and Out of Order”
Reviews.Author: TheLodgeNY
Reviews.Content: We thought this would be an ideal place to spend the night prior to a cruise. We arrived on time and checked in. The elevator didn't work and everyone had to use the stairs. We were told that the elevator was only used for luggage. So the narrow staircase was the only path for everyone coming and going. This proved particularly difficult on check out when the only down with our bags was via the stairs. We were handed our room key and directed up the stairs. The door to our assigned room was ajar, the room steaming hot and the smell of mold hit us in the face as we entered. We asked for another room and were told that was the only room available unless we wanted to upgrade. Classic bait and switch. We had no choice: asthma, so we moved. Did I mention that most rooms have no windows? Breakfast was dreary and the roof leaked right on our breakfast table. This is a terrible choice for any other than a budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: BfromSC
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last Friday night and thought despite some issues it was a good deal for 120 including tax. This hotel is in a great location of Old SJ, however it is difficult to find if you are not familiar with OLD SJ like us. Our room was very small, but we expected that in this area however it was also rather rough around the edges. For example, there were small holes and stains on the sheets and the back of the bathroom door was downright dirty. There was also a little dirt in the shower the washed down the drain when I turned on the water and about a dozen hairs throughout the bathroom. The employees were very helpful and the breakfast buffet of fruit, danishes, cereal, coffee and juice was fine for this good of a price. The elevator is very slow and seems quite dangerous. We waited 10 minutes (I seriously timed it) for it when we were leaving and the front desk employee finally took it up to my husband when I came down the stairs and noticed it was just sitting empty at the lobby. We slept very well there because the walls are thick and a fan is constantly circulating air since there are not any windows. I would stay there if I returned to the area and would recommend it to a friend who does not mind these issues if the price is right! I don't think you could find a better hotel, at this price in such a great location!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: amoree
Reviews.Content: I stayed at HoJo's on my way back from Vieques. Overrall it was in a great location and the hotel was nice but I don't think it was worth the money being asked. The rooms are very small and it feels a little stuffy. The elevator was small and slow and doesn't always work. The staff was helpful with the few problems we encountered. Our air conditioner stopped working in the middle of the night and we had to change rooms. This was done quickly and the night person was very nice. They did a great job remodeling the place. It was no trip to paradise but it served the purpose and it was quiet. I probably would stay there again but would look to see how big the larger rooms are first.

Reviews.Title: “Really is a great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugMaryland
Reviews.Content: The location really is great -- right on a main sqare, with a trolley stop outside. I had an inside room (so no windows) and that was a little weird, but I was out most of the day and night and came back just to sleep so it didn't affect me. The people were really nice to me throughout my stay -- especially after I missed my flight and had to find a room at 8PM on a Friday night! (Note: Get to the airport 2 hours early no matter what the airline says. The people move really slowly in San Juan! I should have had more than enough time except for the line literally didn't move for 30 minutes, and then just barely). There's nothing glamorous about this place, but it is clean and it's a great price. The free breakfast was more like a hostel breakfast, so unless you're really on a budget, I'd venture out and eat something a little more local in flavor. As for parking, there are several paid lots that seem far away but are actually right on the free trolley line. However, I didn't have to use them -- I had great luck both nights finding street parking between 5-7PM -- after the working people left for the day and before the diners and party-ers came in for the clubs and stuff. When all is said and done, however, I wish I had foregone the rental car -- it was a liability more than an asset. If you do get one, get the smallest one possible -- the streets are very narrow.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Plaza De Armas
HotelInfo.Address: Calle San Jose 202, San Juan 00907, Puerto Rico
